post_text:
We would like to give a shout-out to each student who came out to our basketball tryouts this week! We had 115 signups with many talented players.

We would like to again clarify that there will not be an Athlos middle school basketball team as we have had in years past. The bantam basketball program headed by coach Evans and run with coach Price will be the only basketball program that is offered this year. We will be putting together a similar girl's program as we get closer to winter.

We believe there are many benefits to switching to this new basketball program, including increased opportunities for competition (more games), skill clinics run by an esteemed high school coach, and competition set at a common grade level as opposed to a 6-8 grade team with players at various levels.

Any questions regarding this transition should be directed to our lead athletic performance coach, Dan Price at dprice@athlotutah.org.

Reminder. "Grab and go” meals for our distance learning students will be distributed daily from 12:30-12:50 p.m. Please be on time and aware of other drivers.

Meals are provided by driving through the Driveline lane at the school. School staff is on hand to bring our meals to your vehicle. Please do not exit your vehicle.

For questions, contact the front office at (801) 438-4619.

Please remember that student safety is our number one priority during drop-off and dismissal. Please review and follow the Driveline rules to assure all students are safe during these times.

All families who drive their students to school MUST use Driveline this year to accommodate our health regulations regarding drop off.

Please see our video for a tutorial on Driveline procedures and review our safety policies at: https://www.athlosutah.org/parent-resources/student-safety/

View the video at: https://vimeo.com/231098110

post_text:
Save the date: Picture day will be on September 29 for all Athlos students at Athlos Academy.

Distance learning students will enter through the kindergarten doors on the North side of the building and will be required to wear face coverings within the building (except when having the picture taken).

They will be split into two groups divided by students’ last name.
-A-M - 3:30-4 p.m.
-N-Z - 4-4:30 p.m.

NOTE: Distance learning students will NOT be required to wear uniforms for picture day.

Watch the Lifetouch safety video on how students will have their photos taken at: http://ow.ly/7PQI30r9Z2e

See calendar: https://www.athlosutah.org/calendar/picture-day/

post_text:
How are you staying active this school year?
🏃‍♀️🏃🏃‍♂️

Whether it’s sports, games, or physical exercise, students are encouraged to keep their bodies and minds active.

This school year the Athlos community is invited to participate in “Run the Athlos Network!” This is a virtual “run” to support the Healthy Body element of our program.

You can run the route with us as we travel the combined distance between all of our Athlos network schools. We will provide updates throughout the school year on our progress!

https://www.athlosutah.org/run-the-athlos-network/

post_text:
It’s feel-good Friday! This week we received a very nice message from one of our Athlos parents on the first day of school:

“Thank you! A BIG HUGE thank you to ALL the teachers and staff. Please pass this on to everyone. If I could, I would go to each teacher and say thank you and give them a corona free hug. There were a lot of moving parts this morning and everyone was so nice and helpful. I heard an angry parent, it made me sad and I felt bad and grateful that you chose to open for our students. They need to be in school. Please know how grateful I am to you all! Here’s to an amazing, unique and historical 2020 school year!”

Share with us in the comments a positive moment, kind act, or story that happened to you or your family this week.

post_text:
We are excited to welcome Grayson and Harrison to the Athlos family!

Grayson, who will be entering second grade, is excited to start school with Athlos because he loves "making new friends and can’t wait for science classes."

Harrison, who will be entering kindergarten, is excited to start because he "loves to jump around and can do that here. And the building looks cool!"

Their family chose Athlos because "the three pillars feel like it will help our kids learn while focusing on personal health and well being."

–Athlos Parent

Read more on what our Athlos community had to say about their experiences learning from home: https://www.athlosutah.org/athlos-distance-learning-experience/

Athlos Academy is a K-8, tuition-free public charter school offering options for on-campus and distance learning programs. We are accepting enrollment applications for the 2020-2021 school year.

post_text:
School begins next week!

We’ve created Athlos first day signs to share the excitement of a new school year. Just download a sign, snap a photo of your student on the first day, and share on your social media page and on our Facebook page.

School starts August 18 for grades 1-8, and August 26 for kindergarten!

Find your student's sign at: https://www.athlosutah.org/printable-first-day-of-school-signs-2020/

Use the hashtag #AthlosFirstDay

post_text:
Athlos is offering full-time, five-day-school-weeks to support student learning by providing options for parents to choose between on-campus and distance learning programs.

At Athlos Academy of Utah, students focus on three educational pillars: Prepared Mind, Healthy Body, and Performance Character. We believe an education must instill lifelong mental and physical habits that prepare students to face life’s challenges.

We are accepting enrollment applications for the 2020-2021 school year. We are a K-8, tuition-free public charter school serving students in the Herriman area, providing options for parents to choose between on-campus and distance learning five-day programs this fall.

Apply now: https://www.athlosutah.org/enroll/apply/

Or learn more by contacting our executive director, Mandy Kartchner at: mkartchner@athlosutah.org

post_text:
Is your young scholar looking forward to kindergarten? We are accepting kindergarten applications and registering new students for our 2020-2021 school year.

Our staff are ready to keep our school sanitized and practice proper protocols to keep our students safe and ready to learn. We also have a robust distance learning program with regular virtual check-ins and engaging content for students who are learning from home.

Athlos Academy is a K-8, tuition-free public charter school offering options for on-campus and distance learning programs. We are accepting enrollment applications for the 2020-2021 school year.

Apply at: https://www.athlosutah.org/enroll/apply/

Learn more about extended day kindergarten options: https://www.athlosutah.org/kindergarten-programs-understanding-your-options-2020/

post_text:
We are experiencing a delay in our warehousing that will impact uniform ordering.

Orders placed between August 5 and August 12 will not be fulfilled or shipped until after August 12. Customer service will also be unavailable during this time. We are working to remedy the issue as quickly as possible and will resume operations before August 13 if possible.

We sincerely apologize for any inconvenience this will cause.
text:
We are experiencing a delay in our warehousing that will impact uniform ordering.

Orders placed between August 5 and August 12 will not be fulfilled or shipped until after August 12. Customer service will also be unavailable during this time. We are working to remedy the issue as quickly as possible and will resume operations before August 13 if possible.

We sincerely apologize for any inconvenience this will cause.

Meet Jaxon, one of our newest Athlos students and will be starting first grade this school year! He just moved in from out of state and is excited to start school at Athlos because “I want to meet my teacher and my new friends.”

Jaxon’s family choose Athlos because “It’s a charter school that attends to students learning and developing, individuality, growth, and strength. We want Jaxon to be set up for success in all areas.”

Welcome, Jaxon, we look forward to seeing you!

If you would like to see your child featured in a new student spotlight and be entered in a raffle for an Amazon gift card, find entry details at https://www.athlosutah.org/new-student-raffle-we-want-to-hear-from-you/

post_text:
The Utah Department of Health and Utah's 13 local health departments have developed a COVID-19 School Manual.

The school manual provides up-to-date guidance to help school officials, teachers, and parents make informed decisions about how best to provide a safe learning environment for students and a safe workplace for teachers and employees.

We will be following guidelines in this manual as we continue to plan a safe return to school. Find the manual at: https://www.athlosutah.org/covid-19-school-manual/

Gavin’s family chose Athlos for Gavin because “he is able to sit down and focus on working hard once he has been given the opportunity to move and get out all his wiggles.”

post_text:
Thinking about what to do for your student this coming school year? Athlos Academy is prepared to keep your student learning no matter what the future has in store.

Athlos is dedicated to supporting student learning by providing options for parents to choose between on campus and distance learning programs.

Our staff are ready to keep our school sanitized and practice proper protocols to keep our students safe and ready to learn. We also have a robust distance learning program with regular virtual check-ins and engaging content for students who are learning from home.

We are currently accepting K-8 enrollment applications for the 2020-2021 school year. Athlos Academy of Utah is a tuition-free, public charter school serving Utah residents and the surrounding area. We place a big emphasis on shaping healthy minds, bodies, and character.

Apply now: https://www.athlosutah.org/enroll/apply/

Or learn more by contacting our executive director, Mandy Kartchner at: mkartchner@athlosutah.org

post_text:
Join us in welcoming Alyssa and Jenna to the Athlos family! Alyssa will be starting sixth grade in August and Jenna will be starting third grade. They are both excited to start school with Athlos because they want to meet new friends, wear comfortable uniforms, and have lots of choices.

Shylah, the girls’ mom, said she chose Athlos because of the school’s education model.

“I love the concept of the three pillars and am a huge believer in giving students the opportunity to move and learn simultaneously,” she said.

We are excited to meet you both!

If you would like to see your child featured in a new student feature and be entered in a raffle for an Amazon gift card, find entry details at https://www.athlosutah.org/new-student-raffle-we-want-to-hear-from-you/.

post_text:
Thinking about what to do for your student for this coming school year? Athlos Academy is prepared to keep your student learning no matter what the future has in store.

Athlos is dedicated to supporting student learning by providing options for parents to choose between on campus and distance learning programs.

Our staff are ready to keep our school sanitized and practice proper protocols to keep our students safe and ready to learn. We also have a robust distance learning program with regular virtual check-ins and engaging content for students who are learning from home.

We are currently accepting K-8 enrollment applications for the 2020-2021 school year. Athlos Academy of Utah is a tuition-free, public charter school serving Utah residents and the surrounding area. We place a big emphasis on shaping healthy minds, bodies, and character.

Apply now: https://www.athlosutah.org/enroll/apply/

Or learn more by contacting our executive director, Mandy Kartchner at: mkartchner@athlosutah.org

#AthlosSI

Athlos students aren’t restricted by rigid, teacher-led instruction. Student curiosity leads classroom instruction, allowing students to bounce ideas off each other, learn from mistakes, and build trusting relationships with each other and their teachers.

Athlos Academy is a K-8, tuition-free public charter school with a holistic approach to education.
We are accepting enrollment applications for the 2020-2021 school year for students in the Herriman area.

Apply today: https://www.athlosutah.org/enroll/apply/

Learning healthy habits early on is crucial. By focusing on eating nutritious meals and limiting sugar, Athlos students set themselves on a lifelong wellness course and can positively influence their peers' dietary habits. An Athlos education can help your child learn the wellness habits they need for a long, accomplished life!

We are currently accepting K-8 enrollment applications for the 2020-2021 school year. Athlos Academy of Utah is a tuition-free, public charter school serving Herriman residents and beyond. We place a big emphasis on shaping healthy minds, bodies, and character.

If you are interested in serving your community in this way, please send a completed application to Governance Coordinator Jill Turgeon at jturgeon@athlosacademies.org by July 15.

We encourage all to apply!

See details at: https://www.athlosutah.org/seeking-board-member-candidates/

post_text:
Modeling humility is essential for children to be able to understand what it looks like.

This can be as simple as being humble when winning a family board game, letting your accomplishments speak for themselves, or praising the work and efforts of others in front of your child.

Learn how you can help your family practice this Performance Character trait at home: https://www.athlosutah.org/performance-character-at-home-humility/

post_text:
Meet Aspen, one of our newest Athlos students and the winner to our gift card raffle! Aspen will be starting kindergarten next year. "I am excited to start school at Athlos, because of the athletics. I want to have races with my new friends,” he said.

“I chose Athlos for my child, because of the location and focus on healthy lifestyles,” said his parent, Bailey Donohoo.

We look forward to seeing you next year, Aspen!

Athlos families and visitors, please see our updates to our summer office hours.

From June 3 to 18, the office will be closed to patrons; however, we’ll be available by phone and email from 8-11 a.m.

From June 19 to August 2, the office will be closed.

post_text: Parents and kindergarten students recently held a kindergarten graduation drive-thru! We enjoyed seeing everyone’s decorated vehicles, banners, and posters. Thank you to everyone who helped put this unforgettable event together for these young scholars!
text: Parents and kindergarten students recently held a kindergarten graduation drive-thru! We enjoyed seeing everyone’s decorated vehicles, banners, and posters. Thank you to everyone who helped put this unforgettable event together for these young scholars!

post_text:
We wanted to say thank you for a great school year!

We would like to give a big shout out to each of our amazing teachers, coaches, support staff, and office staff who have put in so much work helping our students succeed throughout the school year, especially during the school closures.

We’d like to give a special thanks to the Athlos Academy of Utah - PTO and to each of our parent volunteers for all the time spent building the Athlos community culture.

Thank you! We look forward to seeing you again next school year!
text:
We wanted to say thank you for a great school year!

We would like to give a big shout out to each of our amazing teachers, coaches, support staff, and office staff who have put in so much work helping our students succeed throughout the school year, especially during the school closures.

We’d like to give a special thanks to the Athlos Academy of Utah - PTO and to each of our parent volunteers for all the time spent building the Athlos community culture.

Thank you! We look forward to seeing you again next school year!

post_text:
Come join us for a Socially Distant Ice Cream Social tomorrow, June 5 from 12 to 2 p.m. in the Athlos Academy parking lot. This event is open to families interested in enrolling at Athlos.

We will be featuring ice-cream from The Scoop, a locally owned ice-cream cafe. Our athletic movement coaches will be providing social distance games and activities.

Athlos Academy of Utah is currently accepting enrollment applications for the 2020-2021 school year.

Athlos students experience an education that demands rigorous academic performance, instruction in healthy diet and athletic movement, and an emphasis on building character.

Athlos Academy is a tuition-free, public charter school serving students in grades K-8. Students at Athlos learn to think critically, build essential character traits for success and develop lifelong healthy body habits. We also promote regular family and community engagement.

Apply today!

https://www.athlosutah.org/calendar/socially-distant-ice-cream-social/

Athlos students experience an education that demands rigorous academic performance, instruction in healthy diet and athletic movement, and an emphasis on building character.

Athlos Academy is a tuition-free, public charter school serving students in grades K-8. Students at Athlos learn to think critically, build essential character traits for success and develop lifelong healthy body habits. We also promote regular family and community engagement.

Apply today!

https://www.athlosutah.org/calendar/socially-distant-ice-cream-social/

ATHLOSUTAH.ORG
Socially Distant Ice Cream Social - Athlos Academy of Utah

post_text:
Utah Wild is holding an online ultimate frisbee Zoom event! Utah Wild is a women’s Ultimate Frisbee team comprised of 30 professional players from Utah, Idaho, Montana, and Colorado. They compete in the Western Ultimate League against teams from all over the western USA.

The organization’s goal is to contribute to the growth and development of Ultimate Frisbee in their communities. They are connected to the Utah Ultimate Disc Association which runs most of the Utah youth programs. The Wild are also hoping to run youth camps and clinics when it is safe to do so.

Families, check your email or contact Coach Price at dprice@athlosutah.org if you would like to join this Zoom event.

Learn more: https://www.athlosutah.org/calendar/utah-wild-ultimate-frisbee-zoom-event/

post_text:
Meet Dendi Moreno, our amazing Spanish teacher at Athlos.

“I remember since I was in the 3rd grade, I have always wanted to be a teacher,” she said. “I chose to teach Spanish because I fell in love with the language and the culture. It was like a whole new world of people were opened up to me to be able to communicate with and learn from. I love to travel. This love of the language has suited me well in that very expensive hobby of mine.”

Read more about Dendi in our most recent newsletter: https://www.athlosutah.org/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Griffin-Chronicle-May-1-2020.pdf

Find her school page at: https://www.athlosutah.org/classes/dendi-moreno/

Q: Are meals provided to students during the school closure?
A: Yes. Meals are available once weekly, on Monday, 9 to 10 a.m. Families may come to the school on Mondays and pick up breakfasts and lunches for the entire week (5 breakfasts/5 lunches per child).

See more: https://www.athlosutah.org/aau-school-closure-faq-and-resources/

post_text:
Teachers and Parents,
Next week is Teacher Appreciation Week. Our PTO would like honor our teachers in the best and safest way possible and would like your help in celebrating them through these simple activities.

Shout Out Monday May 4:
Post a picture of your student and share on social media what you like about their teachers. Share a favorite memory or funny story about them. Please use the hashtag #athlosutah.
@AthlosAcademyUtahParentsandTeachers

Teacher Gift drop off Tuesday May 5:
From 9 to 11 a.m. there will be a box at the school available to put a gift of your choosing to give to your teacher. Some ideas can include: a hand written letter, a drawing or painting, a special drink, gift card or treat. Please make sure that your item is clearly labeled as it could be put into the incorrect teachers box if not done properly.

We do realize that our teachers deserve more, any and all options are not required but greatly appreciated.

post_text:
Students are invited to share on social media what they are learning at home during our Athlos Distance Learning Week, April 27 - May 1.

Each day will have a theme students can follow.

-Monday: Show your distance learning workspace and what you like about learning from home.
-Tuesday: Share a photo of your “pet classmates.”
-Wednesday: Show a photo of yourself doing your favorite online distance learning activity. Why is this your favorite lesson?
-Thursday: Share a photo or video of yourself doing movement breaks at home. Why is this your favorite movement break?
-Friday: Share a completed class project or assignment you are proud of.

Learn more: https://www.athlosutah.org/calendar/athlos-loves-distance-learning-week/
shared_text:
ATHLOSUTAH.ORG
Athlos ❤️ Distance Learning Week - Athlos Academy of Utah
text:
Students are invited to share on social media what they are learning at home during our Athlos Distance Learning Week, April 27 - May 1.

Each day will have a theme students can follow.

-Monday: Show your distance learning workspace and what you like about learning from home.
-Tuesday: Share a photo of your “pet classmates.”
-Wednesday: Show a photo of yourself doing your favorite online distance learning activity. Why is this your favorite lesson?
-Thursday: Share a photo or video of yourself doing movement breaks at home. Why is this your favorite movement break?
-Friday: Share a completed class project or assignment you are proud of.

Learn more: https://www.athlosutah.org/calendar/athlos-loves-distance-learning-week/

ATHLOSUTAH.ORG
Athlos ❤️ Distance Learning Week - Athlos Academy of Utah

post_text:
Q: Can parents substitute logging online hours for hands-on learning activities if they’re approved by and reported to the teacher?
A: Just like in the classroom, there will be activities that are assigned by the teacher and/or school. When marked required, these activities cannot be substituted.

Learn more about our frequently asked questions: https://www.athlosutah.org/aau-school-closure-faq-and-resources/

post_text:
Q: Are meals provided to students during the school closure?
A: Yes. Meals are available once weekly, on Monday only, from 9 a.m. to 10 a.m. Families may come to the school between 9 a.m. and 10 a.m. on Mondays and pick up breakfasts and lunches for the entire week (5 breakfasts/5 lunches per child).

See more frequently asked questions at: https://www.athlosutah.org/aau-school-closure-faq-and-resources/

Athlos families.

The Utah NetSmartz has created online videos to share with our students. Many of our students are spending additional time on devices online, it is important that they view these videos!

These videos are tailored to specific ages to teach about digital safety, health, citizenship, and leadership in a fun, interactive way. We cannot stress enough the importance of viewing these presentations with your children.

Learn more: https://www.athlosutah.org/netsmartz-online-video-presentations/

post_text:
The Athlos STAND acronym places emphasis on families to stand beside, stand up for, stand with, and stand in support of their Athlos scholar.

At Athlos Academy, families are expected to be partners in the education and growth of their children. As Athlos holds students and staff to high standards, we also see the essential role of the child’s family in their success in school.

We want to take the time to say thank you to our families for standing with your children and supporting their distance learning from home!

Learn more: https://www.athlosutah.org/about-athlos/the-athlos-approach/#stand

This page will often be updated with new information, so please check back for any updates!

We’re starting a new weekly trend called shout-out Mondays, where we kick the week off with a shout-out to an individual(s) who have made a significant impact on the Athlos community.

We’ll start by giving a shout-out to the amazing kitchen staff who have been making and packing meals for our students each week!

You are welcome to tag and comment below and give a shout-out to a teacher, friend, or community member who has recently made a difference during the school closure.

post_text:
Athlos families, we want to hear from you!

We’re looking to share stories and activities from around our Athlos community to unite and inspire others throughout the remainder of the school year. We miss seeing our students and hearing about their day!

Please share and tag us in everything from sidewalk art, class projects, athletic movements, creative hobbies, and more. We are interested in hearing from you to share with others!

Share in the comments below or shoot us a message.

post_text:
Athlos family and staff,

Due to heightened precautions surrounding COVID-19 (Corona Virus) and following a statement from Utah Governor Gary R. Herbert today, April 14, Athlos Academy of Utah has extended its school closure through the end of the 2019-2020 school year.

We will not return to school at our school building this school year, however, learning will continue through our distance learning plan. This is an extension of the soft closure announced by Governor Herbert on March 13.

To assure students are still meeting instructional hours, we will continue to provide online instruction during the closure. Online instruction is being guided through i-Ready and through live and recorded lessons.

Information can be found at: https://bit.ly/2Wm7F0r

This is a live document updated with the most recent distance learning information.

As always, the safety of students is our number one priority.

For questions, please contact Mandy Kartchner, mkartchner@athlosutah.org or call the school at (801) 438-4619.

Athlos families. We ask that you please provide feedback about your distance learning experience by completing a survey. This survey was sent to you through email and text message.

Please be as specific as possible in your answers. For example, please reference specific platforms when possible (i.e. Zoom, i-Ready, Google, Videos, etc.).

Thank you all for your support and patience as we work to implement our distance learning plans during school closure. Continuing to provide students with learning opportunities is a top priority of our school during this time.

A: Absolutely, just make sure by Sunday at 5 p.m. you have logged all of your time.

Learn more about our frequently asked questions: https://www.athlosutah.org/aau-school-closure-faq-and-resources/

post_text:
Athlos families.

In an effort to ensure that your student is getting targeted instruction on i-Ready, you will occasionally see them working on a growth monitoring assessment.

It is critical that you allow your student to do this work completely on their own. i-Ready takes the data from these "check-ins" and adjusts their instruction on their weekly assignments.

Your child will see challenging problems on these assessments but only because the program is working to place them where they will be appropriately challenged. It is okay if they get problems wrong, if you are helping them through these difficult problems, they are going to be placed at a level that may be way too difficult for them.

Please let them complete this assessment without any help. Definitely support them emotionally but let them know that if is okay to get some wrong.

Thank you for being invested in your students' learning, we miss you all very much!
text:
Athlos families.

In an effort to ensure that your student is getting targeted instruction on i-Ready, you will occasionally see them working on a growth monitoring assessment.

It is critical that you allow your student to do this work completely on their own. i-Ready takes the data from these "check-ins" and adjusts their instruction on their weekly assignments.

Your child will see challenging problems on these assessments but only because the program is working to place them where they will be appropriately challenged. It is okay if they get problems wrong, if you are helping them through these difficult problems, they are going to be placed at a level that may be way too difficult for them.

Please let them complete this assessment without any help. Definitely support them emotionally but let them know that if is okay to get some wrong.

Thank you for being invested in your students' learning, we miss you all very much!

post_text:
--Update--

Athlos meals will be available once weekly, on Monday only, from 9 a.m. to 10 a.m. Families may come to the school between 9 a.m. and 10 a.m. on Mondays and pick up breakfasts and lunches for the entire week (5 breakfasts/5 lunches per child).

Learn more: https://www.athlosutah.org/grab-and-go-meals-available-on-mondays-only-starting-march-30-2020/

--Original--

Beginning on Thursday, March 26, we will be moving from offering meal pickup at the school twice daily, to one daily time for meal pickup. We will offer meal pickup Monday through Friday from 9 a.m. to 10 a.m. Breakfast and lunch for that day can be picked up during this time.

Meals will still be available by following the school’s Driveline route. Please stay in your vehicles, meals will be brought to you.

We will not be serving meals the week of spring break, April 6-10.

If you have any questions, contact the school at (801) 438-4619.

post_text:
The Athlos STAND acronym places emphasis on families to stand beside, stand up for, stand with, and stand in support of their Athlos scholar.

At Athlos Academy, families are expected to be partners in the education and growth of their children. As Athlos holds students and staff to high standards, we also see the essential role of the child’s family in their success in school.

We want to take the time to say thank you to our families for standing with your children and supporting their distance learning from home!

Learn more: https://www.athlosutah.org/about-athlos/the-athlos-approach/#stand

The “E” in SERVE stands for entrepreneurship!
💼👩‍⚕️👨‍🚒

--Updated--

Athlos families and staff,

We will resume our temporary office hours tomorrow, March 19, between 8 a.m. and 11 a.m. We will be available through phone and email during these times; however, families should not come into the school building.

Packets will also be available for families who do not have access to technology between 8 a.m. and 9 a.m. on Mondays.

Grab-and-go breakfast will be available for pickup between 8-9 a.m. on Mondays.

Previously planned distance learning expectations will continue as scheduled.

If you have questions, please contact the school at (801) 438-4619.

Thank you.

Athlos Academy of Utah has extended its school closure through May 1, 2020.

Learn more: https://www.athlosutah.org/school-closure-extended-through-may-1-2020/

--Original message--

To assure students are still meeting instructional hours, we will move to an online instruction model until March 27.

Online instruction will be guided through i-Ready. You should have received your student’s login information for i-Ready, if not please contact your child’s homeroom teacher. To be counted as present during e-learning, your child will need to be logged in to i-Ready and present for at least 2 hours daily.

Learn more: https://www.athlosutah.org/school-closure/

post_text:
Our PTO is in need of volunteers to fill positions for the upcoming school year! Tomorrow, March 13 is your last chance to submit a nomination form.

Please consider volunteering and help support your students and the mission of Athlos Academy.

The PTO is a great organization who helps support programs throughout our school and provides opportunities for your students.

The following positions still need to be filled:

- Programs VP
- Hospitality Chair
- Teacher Appreciation Chair
- Volunteer Coordinator
- Room Parent Coordinator
- Box Tops Chair
- Fundraising Chair
- Book Fair Chair
- Teacher Committee

To apply, please submit a nomination form via your child's teacher or the front office by this Friday, March 13.

The election will be held at the Athlos PTO General Assembly Meeting on April 16 at 7 p.m. in Room 126.

For any questions please contact the PTO at aautpto@gmail.com

Nomination forms: https://www.athlosutah.org/wp-content/uploads/2020/01/Nomination-Form-2020-2021.pdf

At Athlos Academy, we want to create a clear educational path for our students. We’ve teamed up with REAL Salt Lake Academy, a tuition-free public STEM charter, to offer our eighth-grade students the opportunity to transition to an excellent high school.

Learn more about our partnership with REAL: https://www.athlosutah.org/real-matriculation-agreement/

Athlos is accepting K-8 enrollment applications for the 2020-2021 school year. Provide your child with a long-term educational plan and apply now: https://www.athlosutah.org/enroll/apply/

We are a tuition-free public charter serving families in the Herriman area.

post_text:
Dear Athlos families and staff,

COVID-19 remains a top concern for Athlos Academy of Utah. At this time, staff and students are reporting to work and school as usual. School leadership is actively monitoring the situation closely and is working with local experts to determine next steps. We have sent an email to families and staff this morning regarding precautions the school is taking. Please check your email for details, and we will keep you updated with timely communication. Thank you.

Staff, students, and parents enjoyed time playing games, visiting stories, strolling through the book fair, and meeting Dog Man. We would like to give a shout-out to those who came dressed up as their favorite story book character!

post_text:
Student attendance is one of the most common predictors of academic achievement.

Athlos has found that students who participate fully in school activities have more opportunities to achieve academically, make healthy and informed lifestyle choices, and develop Performance Character traits.

Learn more at: https://www.athlosutah.org/attendance-matters-the-impact-of-tardiness-on-student-success/

Lessons learned in a child’s earliest years are very important. Athlos kindergarten students learn in the classroom, but they also learn healthy body habits and positive character traits that will set them on a path to success.

Set your preschooler up for success with an Athlos education. We are accepting kindergarten enrollment applications for the 2020-2021 school year: https://www.athlosutah.org/enroll/apply/

Athlos Academy is a K-8, tuition-free public charter school serving families in the Herriman area.

post_text:
Our PTO is in need of volunteers to fill positions for the upcoming school year! This Friday, March 13 is your last chance to submit a nomination form.

Please consider volunteering and help support your students and the mission of Athlos Academy.

The PTO is a great organization who helps support programs throughout our school and provides opportunities for your students.

The following positions still need to be filled:

- Programs VP
- Hospitality Chair
- Teacher Appreciation Chair
- Volunteer Coordinator
- Room Parent Coordinator
- Box Tops Chair
- Fundraising Chair
- Book Fair Chair
- Teacher Committee

To apply, please submit a nomination form via your child's teacher or the front office by this Friday, March 13.

The election will be held at the Athlos PTO General Assembly Meeting on April 16 at 7 p.m. in Room 126.

For any questions please contact the PTO at aautpto@gmail.com

post_text:
Taking on new challenges takes courage. Each day in Athlos classrooms, students learn Performance Character traits like courage, so they can have the skills they need to become successful, well-balanced adults.

Help your child build traits like courage with an Athlos education. Apply today: https://www.athlosutah.org/enroll/apply/

Athlos Academy of Utah is a K-8, tuition-free, public charter school dedicated to building healthy minds, bodies, and character. We serve families in the Herriman area.

post_text:
Join us in welcoming Tatum to the Athlos family! She is starting first grade with us this fall and we are looking forward to having her in class. Tatum said she is excited to start school at Athlos.

“I’ll see my sister around campus and learn more,” she said.

Tatum’s mom, Isabel, said she chose Athlos because she was looking for a well-rounded school with a different structure than a traditional public school.

Want to see your child featured in a new student spotlight and be entered in a raffle to win a family movie night? Find entry details at: https://www.athlosutah.org/new-students-show-your-exciteme…/

Submissions are due by March 11. We look forward to hearing from you!

post_text:
At Athlos Academy of Utah, we SERVE our students by providing them with an education suited for modern challenges and a lifetime of wellness.

Each letter of SERVE represents Athlos’ commitment to offering core and extra-curricular curriculum essential for success in the 21st century.

Give your child the skills they need to succeed. Apply now: https://www.athlosutah.org/enroll/apply/

Athlos Academy is a K-8, tuition-free, public charter school in Herriman dedicated to building healthy minds, bodies, and character.

Today, Athlos students and staff celebrated Dr. Seuss’s birthday with cinnamon rolls, milk, and oranges! Thank you to the staff, volunteers, and parents who put together this fun-filled occasion to help students remember the importance of reading.

We would also like to give a shout-out to the kitchen staff for all of their hard work making cinnamon rolls for this event!

The mission of the school counseling program at Athlos Academy of Utah is to provide a safe learning environment for every student. We focus on supporting students academically, socially, and emotionally to gain the necessary skills to be successful in life.

Learn more about our student support services at: https://www.athlosutah.org/academics/student-support-services/#counseling

post_text:
Reminder.
This Friday, March 6 will be a half day for all students to make up instructional time from days missed earlier this year.

- The school day will run from 7:55 a.m. to 11:55 a.m. for regular classes.
- Morning kindergarten will take place from 7:55 a.m. to 9:55 a.m.
- Afternoon kindergarten will take place from 10:15 a.m. to 11:55 a.m.

Breakfast will be served, but no lunch will be served on March 6.

If you have any questions, please contact the front office at (801) 438-4619.

Seventh-grade students in our college and career awareness class recently worked in group projects in order to highlight and present professional careers ranging from agriculture to business and marketing.

Each group of students created their own booth and activity for the other grades to participate in by practicing the Performance Character traits initiative and creativity. The fair was a huge success thanks to both our students and Ms. Morris’s hard work.

Athlos families are encouraged to donate 30 hours of their time each year in service to the school.

We have multiple volunteer opportunities available, including monitoring during lunch and recess, assisting a teacher with a project, helping to assemble project kits at home, and others.

There’s lots to do, and we need you!

Learn more about how you can volunteer at: https://www.athlosutah.org/parent-resources/volunteer/

Missing something?

We have many unclaimed items in our lost and found. For questions, visit the front office during regular hours or call us at 801-438-4619.

Please remember to:
- Mark your children’s jackets with their names
- Check the label of your children’s jacket to make sure they have the right one
- Come to the school’s lost and found if your child is missing an item

Thank you!

Athlos families. We have finalized details for our half-day make-up day on March 6.

Friday, March 6 will be a half day for all students to make up instructional time from days missed earlier this year.

- The school day will run from 7:55 a.m. to 11:55 a.m. for regular classes.
- Morning kindergarten will take place from 7:55 a.m. to 9:55 a.m.
- Afternoon kindergarten will take place from 10:15 a.m. to 11:55 a.m.

Breakfast will be served, but no lunch will be served on March 6.

If you have any questions, please contact the front office at (801) 438-4619.

Find out more about the application process and our partnership with REAL Salt Lake Academy at: https://www.athlosutah.org/real-matriculation-agreement/

post_text:
We want to welcome Phoenix to the Athlos family! Phoenix is starting kindergarten at Athlos Academy this fall and is full of energy and enthusiasm.

Kylie, Phoenix’s mother, said her daughter expressed excitement for starting school at Athlos Academy so she can “go to school with the big kids and play games in their huge gym.”

“We love the three Pillars of learning (Prepared Mind, Healthy Body, Performance Character),” Kylie said. “We wanted to teach our girls to be healthy, to be active, and to build a love for learning without feeling like they could not have fun.”

Want to see your child featured in a new student spotlight and be entered in a raffle to win a family movie night? Find entry details at: https://www.athlosutah.org/new-students-show-your-excitement-win-a-family-movie-night/

Kelaiah said she is excited to start kindergarten at Athlos because she will get to see her cousin. Kelaiah’s mother, Kassidie, said she chose Athlos Academy because she wants her child to “have a fun and unique education.”

Want to see your child featured in a new student feature and be entered in a raffle to win a family movie night? Find entry details at: https://www.athlosutah.org/new-students-show-your-excitement-win-a-family-movie-night/

Submissions are due by March 11. We look forward to hearing from you!

post_text:
It takes a village to raise a child. That’s why our Athlos educators and families team up to help students develop positive academic, athletic, and character habits essential to a lifetime of wellness and success.

Become part of the Athlos family today! Seats are filling fast for the 2020-2021 school year: https://www.athlosutah.org/enroll/apply/

Athlos Academy of Utah is a K-8, tuition-free public charter school serving families in the Herriman area.

Amiia said she is eager to start kindergarten at Athlos Academy because she is excited to learn and meet new friends. Amiia’s mother, Andrea, said she chose our school because she wants the “best education” for her daughter and she “heard Athlos is one of the best schools in the area!”

post_text:
The Athlos Academy model is based on a simple philosophy: an education should go beyond learning in the classroom.

While traditional classroom time is very important, research shows integrating athletics and character building into the learning process can have greater positive outcomes for students of all ages. Apply today for the 2020-2021 school year:
https://www.athlosutah.org/enroll/apply/

Athlos Academy of Utah is a K-8, tuition-free public charter school serving families in the Herriman area.

The Athlos PTO will be collecting Box Tops until this Friday, February 14!

This is an excellent way for families and students to get involved raising funds for the school. You can get them ready by making sure they are not expired and nicely cut around the edges. You can also help by downloading the Box Tops app on your smart phone or tablet to scan your receipts for Box Tops directly on the app.

Thank you for your participation in this important program that gives back to schools!

We are excited to be introducing our new student, family, and staff role statement acronyms: SERVE, STAND, and LEAD.

These new acronyms will be used in partnership with our three-pillar model and outline how our school supports students in pursuit of high-quality education, and our expectations of parents and educators in supporting student success.

Learn the details of this program at: https://www.athlosutah.org/athlos-student-staff-and-family-role-statements/

post_text: Whether a student is late to class or leaving early, according to the National Center for Education Statistics, missing just 15 minutes of class time every day for a month adds up to almost a whole day of school missed, which can affect student learning and social development.

Athlos Academy supports parent choice in public education. Our mission is to provide families with an excellent tuition-free, public alternative that teaches children to excel in the classroom, maintain healthy diet and exercise habits, and foster key character traits like humility and optimism.

Join the Athlos family today! Submit an enrollment application and schedule a school tour: https://www.athlosutah.org/

Athlos Academy of Utah is a K-8, tuition-free charter school serving families in the Herriman area.

post_text:
Athlos families,

As we have previously announced, we are excited about an agreement in the works with REAL Salt Lake on a possible partnership that will give our eighth-grade students priority enrollment at REAL for ninth grade. The partnership was voted on by both our school board and the school board of REAL Salt Lake. Both boards voted in favor of the partnership.

As the next step in the process, the agreement must be voted on by the Utah State Charter School Board. We had previously sent a communication that mistakenly stated the Utah State Board of Education would vote on the agreement on February 6. This was an error on our part.

The Utah State Charter School Board will vote on the agreement on Thursday, February 13. We apologize for any confusion this has caused and will update you after the board meeting next week.
text:
Athlos families,

As we have previously announced, we are excited about an agreement in the works with REAL Salt Lake on a possible partnership that will give our eighth-grade students priority enrollment at REAL for ninth grade. The partnership was voted on by both our school board and the school board of REAL Salt Lake. Both boards voted in favor of the partnership.

As the next step in the process, the agreement must be voted on by the Utah State Charter School Board. We had previously sent a communication that mistakenly stated the Utah State Board of Education would vote on the agreement on February 6. This was an error on our part.

The Utah State Charter School Board will vote on the agreement on Thursday, February 13. We apologize for any confusion this has caused and will update you after the board meeting next week.

Due to our recent school cancelations on Wednesday, January 29 and Monday, February 3, we will need to make up instructional hours. To do this, we will be making a change to our schedule in March.

Previously, Friday, March 6 was a scheduled day off for staff professional development. Friday, March 6 will now be a half-day for students.

If you have any questions, please contact the front office at (801) 438-4619 or email info@athlosutah.org.

See details: https://www.athlosutah.org/make-up-half-day-march-6-2020/

post_text:
Athlos Families,

On Wednesday, February 5, Big Budah, a features reporter from Fox 13 Good Day Utah, will be filming a feature at our school. We will have an additional morning breakfast time at 7 a.m. to accommodate filming. During this time, Fox 13 will be filming for Cool School of the Week.

If you would like your child to be part of the filming, they can attend the early breakfast at 7 a.m. We will also serve breakfast at the regularly scheduled time at 7:30 a.m. on Wednesday.

Due to our snow day Monday, we have had some changes to our lunch menu. Please contact the front office at (801) 438-4619 with any questions.

Updates can be found on our menu at: https://www.athlosutah.org/parent-resources/menus-nutrition/

Dear Athlos families and staff,

This is a reminder, that in the case of a school closure or delay due to weather conditions, you will be notified via email and text, through our website, social media, and local media outlets. Athlos Academy follows the lead of the Jordan school district when making weather-related decisions.

If you have any questions, please contact the front office by email at info@athlosutah.org or call (801) 438-4619. Thank you.

post_text:
Today, January 31 at 2:30 p.m. is your last chance to stop by the lost and found to pick up any jackets, coats, lunch bags, bottles, etc. you may be missing before they are donated.

For questions, visit the front office during regular hours or call us at 801-438-4619.

Please remember to:
- Mark your children’s jackets with their names
- Check the label of your children’s jacket to make sure they have the right one
- Come to the school’s lost and found if your child is missing an item

Athlos Academy students start each morning prepared to learn. As each day begins, our educators lead group huddles to gauge students’ readiness to learn and ensure all potential distractions are addressed before lessons begin.

Our educators strive to build strong, supportive interpersonal relationships among students, so they feel safe and included, allowing their time in the classroom to be as productive as possible.

Join the Athlos family today! We are now accepting K-8 enrollment applications for the 2020-2021 school year: https://www.athlosutah.org/

Athlos Academy of Utah is K-8, tuition-free public charter school serving families in the Herriman area.

post_text:
Building self-esteem and self-confidence early on is an essential component for a lifetime of wellness. Research links play and motor skill development with forming positive self-perception among boys and girls.

That’s why Athlos Academy of Utah students participate in daily classroom movement breaks and experience athletic instruction four times per week from our professional coaches on our indoor turf and basketball court. A focus on athletic development is in addition to rigorous academics and character development.

Give your child the Athlos edge! Submit an enrollment application for the 2020-2021 school year today: https://www.athlosutah.org/enroll/apply/

Athlos Academy of Utah is K-8, tuition-free public charter school serving families in the Herriman area.

For Athlos Academy students, learning in the classroom means engaging in deep thinking, conversing with educators and fellow students, and problem solving by stepping outside of the box.

Athlos Academy of Utah is a K-8, tuition-free charter school. We are now accepting enrollment applications for the 2020-2021 school year: https://www.athlosutah.org/enroll/apply/

Students at Athlos learn that mistakes are part of the discovery process and are an integral part of success. Our educators inspire students to tackle academics confidently, empowering them to take ownership in the education process and have pride in their accomplishments.

Come see the advantages of enrolling your child at Athlos. We offer a three-pillar approach to education by developing young minds, bodies, and character.

We take your child’s educational experience very seriously at Athlos Academy. That’s why our educational and athletic facilities are built state-of-the-art, so our students have access to the resources they need for long-term success!

Athlos Academy of Utah is a K-8, tuition-free public charter school. We are now accepting enrollment applications for the 2020-2021 school year: https://www.athlosutah.org/enroll/apply/

Our 96,000 square foot campus features a full-size indoor basketball court and athletic turf for indoor athletic movement instruction, as well as fully modern classrooms, library, gym area, lecture hall and outdoor play areas.

Students at Athlos Academy experience a three-pillar approach to education by developing their minds, bodies, and character.

post_text:
Join us for an open house for all grades tonight, January 16 to see how Athlos Academy of Utah in Herriman can give your child the education they need to succeed!

Tour our modern facilities and learn about our world-class educational model focused on academics as well as body and character development. Our driven leadership staff will be on hand to answer questions and help parents get started on enrollment.

Enrollment applications are also available on our website: www.athlosutah.org.

Athlos Academy is a tuition-free, public charter school in serving students in grades K-8.

We think that education should focus on a comprehensive approach, specifically three key pillars: Prepared Mind, Healthy Body, and Performance Character.

Athlos students learn to think outside the box, build character traits like grit and humility, and develop lifelong healthy body habits. We also know how the importance of family engagement and community interaction.

post_text:
A young mind’s curiosity drives learning. That’s why Athlos Academy of Utah students aren’t restricted by rigid, teacher-led instruction. Student curiosity leads classroom instruction, allowing students to bounce ideas off each other and learn to view mistakes as learning experiences.

Athlos educators build trusting relationships with students and give them the confidence they need to explore curiosity. Trusting relationships are also developed between students so they aren’t afraid to contribute to lessons and offer their innovative approach to problem solving.

Athlos Academy is a K-8, tuition-free public charter school with a holistic approach to education. Students hone their minds in the classroom, develop their bodies during athletic movement sessions, and develop essential character traits for long-term success.

We are now accepting enrollment applications for the 2020-2021 school year for students in the Herriman area.

Apply today and see what an Athlos education can do for your child: https://www.athlosutah.org/enroll/apply/

post_text:
Establishing healthy habits early on creates a foundation of wellness that lasts a lifetime.

According to the Centers for Disease Control, about 17 percent of adults between the ages of 18-24 in Utah are considered obese. Athlos Academy of Utah aims to lower that number by teaching students the importance of a healthy diet and consistent exercise.

Four times each week, Athlos students participate in athletic movement classes led by our coaches. Students learn the fundamentals of exercise and are encouraged to challenge themselves and their peers. Students also learn the ins and outs of a healthy diet and are encouraged to follow dietary habits that will keep them fit for life.

Looking for a healthy approach to education? Athlos Academy is a K-8, tuition-free public charter school serving the Herriman area. We are now accepting enrollment applications for the 2020-2021 school year.

Apply now: https://www.athlosutah.org/enroll/apply/

post_text:
We are holding an open house for kindergarten students tonight, January 9 at 6 p.m. This event is for students interested in enrolling for the 2020-2021 school year.

Join us for a school tour, a brief presentation about our innovative education model, and a chance to meet our school leadership team and ask any questions you may have. Computers will be available if you’d like help with the application process.

Athlos Academy of Utah is a tuition-free, public charter school in Herriman serving students in grades K-8.

Athlos Academy offers a unique approach that empowers students to live fulfilling, responsible, and successful lives by building on our three foundational pillars: Prepared Mind, Healthy Body, and Performance Character.

Athlos students develop critical thinking and problem-solving skills, as well as a broad knowledge base and healthy lifestyle habits. Our school culture celebrates high academic achievement, fosters individual growth in fitness and Performance Character, and promotes regular family engagement.

Learn more at www.athlosutah.org

post_text:
Do you want your child to develop the social skills necessary for long-term success and happiness?

Humans are highly social creatures and our interpersonal relationships play a big part in our daily lives. That’s why Athlos Academy of Utah students focus on developing social intelligence as part of our 12 Performance Character traits.

Athlos students learn that interpersonal relationships, whether at school, work, or at home, must be navigated with respect and confidence.

By honing effective speaking and listening skills through lesson integration and interaction with a diverse student body and staff, students are prepared to navigate the complex social situations of adulthood.

Athlos Academy is a K-8, tuition-free public charter school with an emphasis on developing young minds, bodies, and character. See the difference an Athlos education can make in your child’s life! We are now accepting enrollment applications for the 2020-2021 school year.

Apply now: https://www.athlosutah.org/enroll/apply/

Getting back into the school routine can be a rough transition from a long break.

post_text:
When it comes time to decide on your child’s education, why consider Athlos Academy of Utah?

First off, Athlos Academy is a charter school, which allows parents an alternative to the traditional public school system. Secondly, Athlos Academy students can experience greater diversity since the student population is made up of students from different backgrounds and neighborhoods. Thirdly, Athlos students don’t experience a “cookie cutter” education, but focus on development of their minds, bodies, and character.

Come see the difference an Athlos education can make in your child’s future! We are a K-8, tuition free charter school serving students in the Herriman area and are now accepting 2020-2021 enrollment applications.

Apply now: https://www.athlosutah.org/enroll/apply/

post_text:
At Athlos Academy of Utah, we believe that an education should also develop a student’s character.

That’s why Athlos students integrate our 12 Performance Character traits into their curriculum.

Traits like integrity, social intelligence, and leadership help create young citizens who are ready to integrate into and serve their communities. Traits like initiative, grit, and optimism teach students that while failure is a part of life, those who succeed also endure.

If you think your child needs an education that reaches beyond the classroom, submit an enrollment application today! We are currently accepting enrollment applications for the 2020-2021 school year for grades K-8. Athlos Academy is a tuition-free charter school serving families in the Herriman area.

Apply now: https://www.athlosutah.org/enroll/apply/

post_text:
Did you know that Athlos Academy of Utah is a K-8, tuition-free public charter school?

Our students study intensely in the classroom, focus on building strong bodies, and learn to practice key character traits like grit and humility.

Athlos Academy's Herriman campus provides students with state-of-the-art classrooms and indoor athletic facilities. Our amazing teachers help guide students through lessons and character development and our professional athletic coaches teach lifelong exercise and diet habits. An Athlos education is a solid foundation for a successful life.

We are now accepting enrollment applications for the 2020-2021 school year!

Apply now: https://www.athlosutah.org/enroll/apply/

post_text:
A new year is just around the corner and it's a perfect time to reevaluate your child's education!

At Athlos Academy of Utah, students focus on three educational pillars: Prepared Mind, Healthy Body, and Performance Character. We believe an education must instill lifelong mental and physical habits that prepare students to face life’s challenges.

Athlos Academy is now accepting enrollment applications for the 2020-2021 school year! We are a K-8, tuition-free public charter school serving students in the Herriman area.

Apply now: https://www.athlosutah.org/

post_text:
Athlos Academy of Utah's focus on athletic movement is one of the main reasons Laura Fulks said she and her husband enrolled their children at Athlos.

"We thought it would be a really good choice for our son who loves to run around and doesn't like to sit for a long time," she said.

Students at Athlos Academy participate in daily movement breaks in the classroom and are on the turf and basketball court four times each week for athletic instruction.

"Another thing we have really appreciated about Athlos is the character traits they are learning," Fulks said. "In addition to academic lessons each day, they are also learning things like humility, social intelligence, and grit."

Athlos Academy of Utah is now K-8 accepting enrollment applications for the 2020-2021 school year. We are a tuition-free public charter school dedicated to building young minds, bodies and character in the Herriman area.

Apply now: https://www.athlosutah.org/enroll/apply/

post_text:
Did you know that Athlos Academy students not only participate in athletic movement class four times each week, but also learn the importance of a healthy diet? According to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, 18.5 percent of children and adolescents in the U.S. are considered obese.

Learning healthy habits early on is crucial. By focusing on eating nutritious meals and limiting sugar, Athlos students set themselves on a lifelong wellness course and can positively influence their peers' dietary habits.

An Athlos education can help your child learn the wellness habits they need for a long, accomplished life! We are currently accepting K-8 enrollment applications for the 2020-2021 school year. Athlos Academy of Utah is a tuition-free, public charter school serving Herriman residents and beyond. We place a big emphasis on shaping healthy minds, bodies, and character.

Apply now: https://www.athlosutah.org/enroll/apply/

post_text:
Want to see for yourself how our students are learning in the classroom and on the turf?
Athlos Academy of Utah in Herriman is hosting daytime open house hours for the month of December. We are a K-8, tuition-free public charter school and are currently accepting enrollment application for the 2020-2021 school year!

Please call Mack or Courtney at 801-438-4619 to schedule your tour.
At Athlos Academy, our educational model goes beyond simply learning in the classroom. Our students take regular movement breaks that relate to their classroom lessons to help improve focus. Students also take part in regular athletic movement lessons and learn about healthy habits.

Character traits like courage and humility are taught at Athlos, so students learn traits that set them up for a lifetime of success!

Apply online: https://www.athlosutah.org/enroll/apply/

post_text:
The final results for our annual food drive are in!

First place was fourth-grade at 845 items!

Shout-out to Kindergarten and third-grade for each donating just over 500 items each.

The winning class was Mr. Gunn’s fourth-grade class at 532 items. Shout out to Ms. Lyon, Ms. Bowen, and Ms. Martin's classes for each donating over 175 food items.

Thank you to everyone who contributed to the food drive benefiting Utah Food Bank. Together, we totaled 3552 items and weighed in at 2932 lbs.!

We’d like to give a shout out to all the volunteers and student leaders for their hard work counting and sorting the donations every day.

Again, congratulations to the winning grades and classes, and thank you for your generosity!

Our Griffin 400 Club board is almost full!

The Griffin 400 Club recognizes students as part of our Positive Behavior Intervention and Support program. Students who earn REPS cards for positive behavior are invited to draw random numbers and have their name placed on a board with 400 spots. When 10 spots are filled in a row, the school can win a reward.

Keep up the great work students!

Athlos fifth-grade students have been studying important math topics and terms. In science class, they have been learning about heredity and how it plays a role in genetics. They applied their learning to creating “monster genetics.”

We are proud to show off their work and look forward to what they learn in the coming school year!

Tomorrow, December 13, is the last day to donate to the annual Athlos Academy Food Drive!

Food drive updates:

-First place is kindergarten with 453 items.
-Second place is third-grade with 425 items.
-Third place is sixth-grade with 272 items.

The current leading class is Ms. Lyon's kindergarten with a total of 185 items donated.

So far, Athlos has collected 2,202 items! We have a goal to reach 5000 pounds of food by this Friday, December 13.

Nine days in and we still have 3 classes who have not donated anything. Challenge your students and challenge your teachers!

Please check for expired food items before donating, they cannot be accepted.

Learn more: https://www.athlosutah.org/calendar/food-drive-2019/

post_text:
Starting each morning off right is important! That’s why Athlos Academy of Utah students
participate in classroom huddles so they can focus on building strong interpersonal relationships and foster a sense of belonging in the group.

Morning huddles create a routine and structure for students, allowing them to address any potential distractions or personal issues with their supportive peers. Huddles also allow teachers to check in with students and gauge their readiness to learn.

Athlos Academy students focus on developing 12 Performance Character traits like humility and social intelligence and huddles give them the chance to practice those traits on a regular basis.

We are now accepting enrollment applications for the 2020-2021 school for students entering grades K-8 who live in Herriman and all surrounding communities. Athlos Academy is a K-8, tuition-free public charter school with an emphasis on developing the mind, body, and character.

Apply now: https://www.athlosutah.org/enroll/apply/

At Athlos Academy of Utah, our leadership staff works hard to make sure students are given the attention and direction they need to thrive. Assistant director of upper school Awbree Summers said she loves having her own school family.

“I get to be a mom to a bunch of little chickens,” she said. “I love it.”

Summers said the goal at Athlos is for students to excel in the classroom and to become “well-rounded humans” who are prepared to face modern challenges.

Athlos Academy is a tuition-free, public charter school serving residents in the Herriman area. We are now accepting K-8 enrollment applications for the 2020-2021 school year!

Apply now: https://www.athlosutah.org/enroll/apply/

post_text:
Success comes with being able to persevere through the peaks and valleys. That’s why Athlos Academy students learn Performance Character traits like grit. Failure is a part of life and should be used as an opportunity to learn and grow.

Without grit, some of history’s greatest figures wouldn’t have accomplished much. Before being elected President, Abraham Lincoln failed at business endeavors and attempts for public office several times. Imagine if he had just given up?

Athlos Academy of Utah serves Herriman residents and beyond. We are currently accepting K-8 enrollment applications for the 2020-2021 school year! We are a tuition-free, public charter school with a focus on building minds, bodies, and character.

Apply now: https://www.athlosutah.org/enroll/apply/

Athlos families,
As we shift into the colder weather, we ask that families begin making a habit of leaving plenty of time in the morning to get to school.

Student safety is our top priority. Ice can cause injury, increase the risk of road accidents, and can delay school and valuable class time. Please remember to dress warm and take extra precautions in these icy conditions.

For questions, please contact the front desk at: 801-438-4619.

Feel good Friday.

While Ms. Ellermeier’s third-grade class enjoyed group activities, two students took it upon themselves to clean up trash around the playground. “We had watched an indoor field trip on sea turtles and how trash hurts them, so they wanted to help,” said Ms. Ellermeier.

Athlos strives to encourage students to exhibit Performance Character traits in and outside the classroom. Great work, Maylijean and Olivia, for demonstrating leadership and taking initiative to keep our school clean and tidy.

post_text:
The attitudes we choose shape our daily lives. That’s why Athlos students learn the importance of optimism as part of our school’s 12 Performance Character traits.

Even when things don’t go the way we planned, having a good attitude and thinking on the bright side can make the best of what seems to be a bad situation.

Studies show that an attitude of optimism can also reduce stress and have a positive overall effect on mental health and that optimistic students perform better in the classroom and life overall.

We are currently accepting K-8 applications for the 2020-2021 school year! Athlos Academy of Utah is a tuition-free public charter school serving residents of Herriman and surrounding areas.

Apply now on our website: https://www.athlosutah.org/enroll/apply/
text:
The attitudes we choose shape our daily lives. That’s why Athlos students learn the importance of optimism as part of our school’s 12 Performance Character traits.

Even when things don’t go the way we planned, having a good attitude and thinking on the bright side can make the best of what seems to be a bad situation.

Studies show that an attitude of optimism can also reduce stress and have a positive overall effect on mental health and that optimistic students perform better in the classroom and life overall.

We are currently accepting K-8 applications for the 2020-2021 school year! Athlos Academy of Utah is a tuition-free public charter school serving residents of Herriman and surrounding areas.

Apply now on our website: https://www.athlosutah.org/enroll/apply/

post_text:
Here are the most recent updates for our classes:

-First place is third-grade with 193 items.
-Second place is kindergarten with 171 items.
-Third place is second-grade with 89 items.

The current leading class is Ms. Lyon's kindergarten with a total of 94 items donated.

So far, Athlos has collected almost 800 items! We have a goal to reach 5000 pounds of food by next Friday, December 13.

We have a couple classes who have not yet donated anything. Challenge your students and your teachers to donate and win some amazing prizes!

Learn more: https://www.athlosutah.org/calendar/food-drive-2019/

post_text:
We recently heard about two Athlos students taking the initiative to serve their neighbors. Here’s the story.

Hayden and Jacob are brothers and students at Athlos (pictured). Last week, Ms. Whitmore, a substitute teacher at Athlos, spotted them exhibiting Performance Character traits initiative and humility by shoveling the walks of their neighbors’ homes up and down the street during a snowstorm. They shoveled late into the evening to make sure everyone had clear sidewalks.

We’d like to give a shout-out to Hayden and Jacob for taking the initiative to serve and showing integrity for doing so even if no one was watching. At Athlos, we strive to encourage our students to apply our Performance Character traits wherever they are, both in and outside the classroom.

post_text:
Did you know Athlos students are active for about 115 minutes per day, more than the 60 minutes recommended by the American Heart Association?

Regular athletic movement classes and movement breaks in the classroom not only help students refocus, but also reinforce academic lessons.

Research has proven that regular exercise helps with academic performance and developing physical literacy early on is crucial for sustaining a healthy body and mind. Athlos understands that movement supports learning.

We're now accepting K-8 enrollment applications for the 2020-2021 school year! Give your child an education that focuses on mind and body development. Athlos Academy of Utah is a tuition-free public charter school serving students in Herriman and surrounding areas.

Apply online today: https://www.athlosutah.org/enroll/apply/

Enrollment for the 2020-2021 school year opens Dec. 1!

Come see on December 5 how Athlos Academy of Utah in Herriman can give your child the education they need to succeed!

Come see our modern facilities and learn about our world-class educational model focused on academics as well as body and character development. Our driven leadership staff will be on hand to answer questions and help parents get started on enrollment.

Enrollment applications will become available online on December 1 at: www.athlosutah.org.

Athlos Academy is a tuition-free, public charter school serving students in grades K-8.

We think that education should focus on a comprehensive approach, specifically three key pillars: Prepared Mind, Healthy Body, and Performance Character. Athlos students learn to think outside the box, build character traits like grit and humility, and develop lifelong healthy body habits. We also know how the importance of family engagement and community interaction.

Athlos parents: We have many unclaimed items in our lost and found.

Next Tuesday, November 26 at 4 p.m. is your last chance to stop by and pick up any jackets, coats, lunch bags, bottles, etc. you may be missing before they are donated.

For questions, visit the front office during regular hours or call us at 801-438-4619.

Please remember to:
- Mark your children’s jackets with their names
- Check the label of your children’s jacket to make sure they have the right one
- Come to the school’s lost and found if your child is missing an item

Thank you!

The Athlos PTO’s winter boutique was a huge success! They raised more than $6,500 and passed their fundraising goal!

We’d like to give a shoutout to the Athlos Academy Utah PTO, the committed volunteers, staff, and community for their contributions to the winter boutique! We’d also like to thank the food trucks Jurassic Street TACOS and Waffle Love for supporting our visitors with great food.

Athlos Academy values strong community relationships with local businesses and vendors. There were a plethora of beautiful baskets filled with goodies for all to enjoy. Many baskets contained homemade projects and loads of creativity all created by our contributing parents.

We have a winner for the kindness poster contest!

Congratulations to fourth-grader, Nala Alton for your poster submission! This poster will also be displayed on the school website and printed for use in our school. The goal behind this contest is to literally help create and spread kindness in our school.

Thank you to everyone who participated and submitted a poster, we have many talented and creative students in our school that made it difficult to come down to a finalist.

Ms. Ellermeier’s third-grade class recently learned about animals and how they adapt in the state of Utah. They formed student groups where they were able to see and feel local animal skins, and then present what they learned to the rest of the class.

Thank you Swaner Preserve and EcoCenter for providing our students with this educational opportunity!

post_text:
At Athlos, students get recognized daily by teachers and support staff with colored tickets for showing positive student behaviors both inside and outside of the classroom.

Students have the choice to enter the tickets in for a daily drawing, or this month save 40 tickets as an entrance fee for our principals and pizza event. We had 36 students that earned this reward and left the event with bellies full of pizza.

Excellent work students!

The deadline to submit to the kindness poster contest is October 31!

Athlos Academy is holding its first annual kindness poster contest! Athlos is calling on all student-artists in all grade levels to submit their best artwork for the competition.

This year’s kindness poster theme is: Kindness Begins with Me!

Winners of the contest will literally help create and spread kindness in our school. The school winners will be recognized at the November school board meeting and will receive a Kindle tablet device. Winning posters will also be posted on the school website and printed for use in our school.

Learn contest details at: https://www.athlosutah.org/kindness-poster-contest/

post_text:
At Athlos, students learn how to become active, fit, and efficient movers. Coach Stanton demonstrates this through a lesson of body control where first-grade students learned balance and control by carefully balancing balls of yarn on frisbees while moving around a select area. Lessons such as this teach correct posture, hand-eye coordination, and body control.

Learn more about our school’s Healthy Body pillar at: https://www.athlosutah.org/academics/healthy-body-pillar/

Meet our school counselors, Jennifer Saderholm and Jessica Winward.

“If your student needs help with a personal or academic issue, we are here for them. Our job is to listen to student and parent concerns and do our best to help in whatever way we can. Our goal is to ensure that each and every student reaches their fullest potential in school and life.”

The mission of the school counseling program at Athlos Academy of Utah is to provide a safe learning environment for every student.

Learn more about our student support services at: https://www.athlosutah.org/academics/student-support-services/#counseling

Athlos families: There will be a change in the way students and parents enter the building for breakfast effective Monday, September 30.

All students must enter through the front office doors. Any parents who wish to attend breakfast with their children must check in at the front office and have their ID scanned to enter the building.

When leaving the school, parents must exit through the front office and check out. This is to ensure that our building is secure from 7:30 a.m. until 3:30 p.m. for our students and staff.

Please contact the front office with questions at (801) 438-4619. Thank you.

post_text:
Athlos families,
As we enter the cold and flu season, we are asking that all parents, students, and Athlos staff do their best to take extra care in daily hygiene. As part of attendance awareness month, we encourage sick students to stay home in order to keep from spreading illness throughout the rest of the school and potentially causing more students to miss class.

Common wellness steps include staying hydrated, wearing proper cold weather attire, washing hands regularly, and getting plenty of sleep.

It’s important that all of our students stay healthy, active, and ready to learn.
Thank you.

Our third-grade students recently received a presentation, Our Place in the Universe, provided by retired geologist and current director of the Stansbury Park Observatory Complex, Rodger Fry. In this presentation, our students learned about our solar system, the perspective of size in the universe, and deep space.

Thank you, Rodger Fry, for providing our students this educational opportunity!

post_text:
Athlos families,
As we enter the cold and flu season, we are asking that all parents, students, and Athlos staff do their best to take extra care in daily hygiene. As part of attendance awareness month, we encourage sick students to stay home in order to keep from spreading illness throughout the rest of the school and potentially causing more students to miss class.

Common wellness steps include staying hydrated, wearing proper cold weather attire, washing hands regularly, and getting plenty of sleep.

It’s important that all of our students stay healthy, active, and ready to learn.
Thank you.

post_text:
September is attendance awareness month!

Student attendance is one of the most common predictors of academic achievement. Students who consistently miss school hours develop habits that will lead into their adult life, affecting their education, career, and social connections.

Learn more about the importance of school attendance at: https://www.athlosutah.org/attendance-matters-the-impact-of-tardiness-on-student-success/

This Labor Day weekend, Athlos is challenging families to exhibit the Performance Character trait energy/zest through physical activity and engaging in the outdoors!

Whether you’re in the park, your backyard, or on a mountain top, share with us and others on Facebook, Instagram and Twitter using the hashtag #AthlosMoves.
